<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccemcee'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_emcee</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The time to convergence can depend greatly on how the initial points are set up, so if you have a better guess as to location and shape of the posterior, then using those guesses is advised. But, beware overtuning! emcee has some handy utilities to draw samples from around an initial guess. In the example below I show the use of the (now deprecated) <a href="https://emcee.readthedocs.io/en/v2.2.1/api/#emcee.utils.sample_ball"><code>sample_ball()</code></a> function, which creates a ball of samples assuming no correlations between parameters. However, if you knew that your parameter uncertainties had a particular covariance, you could use <code>sample_ellipsoid()</code> to generate a sample cloud using a supplied covarance matrix.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">emcee.utils</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">sample_ball</span>
<span class="n">m_guess</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_guess</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">1.</span> <span class="c1"># guess at the mean of the distribution</span>
<span class="n">m_std</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_std</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">1.</span>     <span class="c1"># guess at the width of the distribution</span>

<span class="c1"># generate samples from a ball based on those guesses</span>
<span class="n">inisamples</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sample_ball</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">m_guess</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_guess</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">m_std</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_std</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nens</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># reset so we don't pick up the result from earlier</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># pass the initial samples and total number of samples required</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="c1"># start time</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run_mcmc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inisamples</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Nsamples</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">Nburnin</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timeemcee</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'emcee' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timeemcee</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># extract the samples (removing the burn-in)</span>
<span class="n">samples_emcee</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_chain</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">flat</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">discard</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nburnin</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'emcee' is 1.8876838684082031 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># plot the resulting posteriors</span>
<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_emcee</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Once the sampler has settled, the samples that come out of MCMC will be drawn from the posterior. However, even in the best of situations, draws which are adjacent are often correlated with each other. The number of "independent" samples, that is, fully independent draws from the posterior can be much fewer than the samples in hand.</p>
<p>The emcee <a href="https://emcee.readthedocs.io/en/v3.0.2/user/sampler/#emcee.EnsembleSampler"><code>EnsembleSampler</code></a> class has an inbuilt function, <a href="https://emcee.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user/sampler/#emcee.EnsembleSampler.get_autocorr_time"><code>get_autocorr_time()</code></a>, to calculate the auto-correlation length (ACL) (or time) - this is an estimate the number of samples between independent samples in the chain. You can use this number to estimate convergence of chains, and also to thin out chains to produce independent samples.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">m_acl</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_acl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_autocorr_time</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">quiet</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"The autocorrelation length for m is </span><span class="si">{0}</span><span class="s2"> and c is </span><span class="si">{1}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">m_acl</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_acl</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># thin out the chain</span>
<span class="n">samples_emcee</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_chain</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">flat</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">discard</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nburnin</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">thin</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">max</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">m_acl</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_acl</span><span class="p">])))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Number of independent samples is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_emcee</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esemcee'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_emcee</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'essemcee'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esemcee'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timeemcee</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'essemcee'</span><span class="p">]))</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the resulting posteriors</span>
<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_emcee</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>WARNING:root:The chain is shorter than 50 times the integrated autocorrelation time for 2 parameter(s). Use this estimate with caution and run a longer chain!
N/50 = 20;
tau: [23.98692287 25.13038681]
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>The autocorrelation length for m is 23.986922869990487 and c is 25.130386813726226
Number of independent samples is 2000
Effective samples per second: 1059
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In practice, if you have a minimum number of independent samples that you require then you can repeatedly run the sampler, checking the ACL each time (and maybe adjusting the <code>c</code> input parameter for <code>get_autocorr_time()</code>), until you have collected the required number.</p>
<p>Checking the ACL is something that can be done for any of the samplers discussed in the rest of this notebook. Different sampling methods can lead to different ACLs, and methods that may take more time per sample might end up having shorter ACLs. So, examining the various trade-offs between overall speed and the final number of independent samples can be worthwhile.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="PyMC3">PyMC3<a class="anchor-link" href="#PyMC3">¶</a></h3><p><a href="http://docs.pymc.io/">PyMC3</a> (<a href="https://peerj.com/articles/cs-55/">Salvatier, Wiecki & Fonnesbeck, 2016</a>) is a Python MCMC implementation that can use a variety of modern sampling method, including "No-U-turn sampling" (NUTS) (<a href="http://www.jmlr.org/papers/v15/hoffman14a.html">Hoffman & Gellman, 2014</a>) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamiltonian_Monte_Carlo">Hamiltonian Monte Carlo</a> (<a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/037026938791197X">Duane <em>et al</em>, 1987</a>), both of which make use of the gradient of the posterior to efficiently sample the space. An example of getting started using PyMC3 can be found <a href="https://docs.pymc.io/notebooks/getting_started#A-Motivating-Example:-Linear-Regression">here</a> upon which this example is based.</p>
<p>This code can be <a href="http://docs.pymc.io/#installation">installed</a> using <code>pip</code> with:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install pymc3
</pre></div>
<p>or with <a href="https://conda.io/docs/index.html">Conda</a> <a href="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pymc3">with</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>conda install -c conda-forge pymc3
</pre></div>
<p>and the source is available on GitHub <a href="https://github.com/pymc-devs/pymc3">here</a>.</p>
<p>The majority of distributions that can be used for priors and likelihood functions are <a href="http://docs.pymc.io/api/distributions.html">predefined</a> in PyMC3, so you do not have to worry about writing them yourself (although you can create your <a href="http://docs.pymc.io/notebooks/getting_started.html#Arbitrary-distributions">own custom distribution</a>).</p>
<p>Note that in PyMC3 the prior and likelihood distributions have to be defined within the <a href="http://book.pythontips.com/en/latest/context_managers.html">context</a> of a PyMC3 <a href="https://docs.pymc.io/api/model.html#module-pymc3.model"><code>Model()</code> class</a>, and cannot be defined outside that context (the <code>with</code> statment). Therefore, to set up the model we can't just use the <code>straight_line()</code> function defined above, but can do the following:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pymc3</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pm</span> <span class="c1"># import PyMC3</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'PyMC3 version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># set the PyMC3 model</span>
<span class="n">linear_model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Model</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">with</span> <span class="n">linear_model</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1"># set prior parameters</span>
    <span class="n">cmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">10.</span> <span class="c1"># lower range of uniform distribution on c</span>
    <span class="n">cmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span>  <span class="c1"># upper range of uniform distribution on c</span>
    
    <span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.</span>     <span class="c1"># mean of Gaussian distribution on m</span>
    <span class="n">msigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span> <span class="c1"># standard deviation of Gaussian distribution on m</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># set priors for unknown parameters</span>
    <span class="n">cmodel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Uniform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lower</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">upper</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cmax</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># uniform prior on y-intercept</span>
    <span class="n">mmodel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Normal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'m'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mu</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">mmu</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sd</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">msigma</span><span class="p">)</span>       <span class="c1"># Gaussian prior on gradient</span>
    
    <span class="n">sigmamodel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sigma</span> <span class="c1"># set a single standard deviation</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Expected value of outcome, aka "the model"</span>
    <span class="n">mu</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mmodel</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">cmodel</span>

    <span class="c1"># Gaussian likelihood (sampling distribution) of observations, "data"</span>
    <span class="n">Y_obs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Normal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Y_obs'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mu</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">mu</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sd</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">sigmamodel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">observed</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>WARNING:theano.tensor.blas:Using NumPy C-API based implementation for BLAS functions.
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>PyMC3 version: 3.11.2
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we can perform the sampling. By default, for continuous variables like we have, the <a href="http://docs.pymc.io/api/inference.html#step-methods">sampling step method</a> will use <a href="http://docs.pymc.io/api/inference.html#module-pymc3.step_methods.hmc.nuts">NUTS</a>, but the method can be chosen manually. We'll run with 1000 samples, and tune (like the burn-in discussed <a href="#MCMC-set-up">above</a>) with 1000 samples (discarding these tuning samples):</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%capture</span>
<span class="n">Nsamples</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1000</span> <span class="c1"># final number of samples</span>
<span class="n">Ntune</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1000</span>    <span class="c1"># number of tuning samples</span>

<span class="c1"># perform sampling</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">with</span> <span class="n">linear_model</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">trace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Nsamples</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tune</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Ntune</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">discard_tuned_samples</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="c1"># perform sampling</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timepymc3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>WARNING:pymc3:The acceptance probability does not match the target. It is 0.8881386717506918, but should be close to 0.8. Try to increase the number of tuning steps.
WARNING:pymc3:The acceptance probability does not match the target. It is 0.9037542650276801, but should be close to 0.8. Try to increase the number of tuning steps.
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'PyMC3' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timepymc3</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'PyMC3' is 4.574299335479736 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, let's extract the samples from the <code>trace</code> object and make a corner plot!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">vstack</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">trace</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'m'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">trace</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">]))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mpymc3_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mpymc3_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpymc3_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpymc3_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccpymc3'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>

<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># calculate the autocorrelation length</span>
<span class="n">acts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">param</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"m"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"c"</span><span class="p">]:</span>
    <span class="n">acts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">emcee</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">autocorr</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">integrated_time</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">trace</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">param</span><span class="p">]))</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Autocorrelation length for '</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">param</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Maximum autocorrelation length is </span><span class="si">{0:.1f}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'espymc3'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esspymc3'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'espymc3'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timepymc3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esspymc3'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Autocorrelation length for 'm' is [4.57782586]
Autocorrelation length for 'c' is [3.95745792]
Maximum autocorrelation length is 4.6
Effective samples per second: 190
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="TensorFlow-Probability">TensorFlow Probability<a class="anchor-link" href="#TensorFlow-Probability">¶</a></h3><p><a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/">TensorFlow Probability</a> (TFP) is a probabilistic modelling framework built upon the <a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/">TensorFlow</a> library. TFP contains some samplers for performing MCMC. At the time of writing TFP is still fairly new, and <a href="https://github.com/tensorflow/probability/tree/master/tensorflow_probability/python/mcmc">currently includes</a> a Hamiltonian MC sampler, a Metropolis-Hastings sampler, and a slice sampler.</p>
<p>TFP can be <a href="https://github.com/tensorflow/probability#stable-builds">installed</a> from <a href="https://pypi.org/">PyPI</a> via <code>pip</code> with:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install tensorflow tensorflow-probability
</pre></div>
<p>where <code>tensorflow</code> must be explicitly installed as it's not a dependency of <code>tensorflow-probability</code>.</p>
<p>Using TFP for MCMC sampling has some similarites to PyMC3, however it can be fairly opaque, and (for me at least!) non-intuitive. The example given does not come with a detailed explanation of the constructions I've used, because I don't have any in-depth knowlegde of them! It was mainly cobbled together by looking at the example given <a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/examples/Eight_Schools">here</a>.</p>
<p>Firstly, we can set up the probablistic model (with a <a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/api_docs/python/tfp/distributions/JointDistributionSequential"><code>JointDistributionSequential</code></a> class) that contains the prior distributions on the parameters of interest and a <code>lambda</code> function defining the likelihood function, within which we write out the straight line model for the data. Some things to be aware of are: the arguments to the <code>lambda</code> function defining the likelihood must be given in the opposite order to that in which those arguments are placed within the <code>JointDistributionSequential</code> class; the <code>name</code> of the <a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/api_docs/python/tfp/distributions/Independent"><code>Independent</code></a> distribution that holds the likelihood function should be the same as the name of the variable that holds the data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># import TensorFlow probability</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">tensorflow_probability</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">tfp</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tensorflow_probability</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">distributions</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">tfd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">tensorflow</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">tf</span>

<span class="n">cmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">10.</span>  <span class="c1"># lower range of uniform distribution on c</span>
<span class="n">cmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span>   <span class="c1"># upper range of uniform distribution on c</span>

<span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of Gaussian distribution on m</span>
<span class="n">msigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span>  <span class="c1"># standard deviation of Gaussian distribution on m</span>

<span class="c1"># convert x values and data to 32 bit float</span>
<span class="n">xtfp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">float32</span><span class="p">)</span>  <span class="c1"># x is being use globally here</span>
<span class="n">datatfp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">float32</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># set model - contains priors and the expected linear model</span>
<span class="n">model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tfd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">JointDistributionSequential</span><span class="p">([</span>
  <span class="n">tfd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Normal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">mmu</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">msigma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"m"</span><span class="p">),</span>  <span class="c1"># m prior</span>
  <span class="n">tfd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Uniform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"c"</span><span class="p">),</span>  <span class="c1"># c prior</span>
  <span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">m</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tfd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Independent</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">tfd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Normal</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="c1"># the Normal likelihood function</span>
            <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">m</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">...</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">newaxis</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">xtfp</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">...</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">newaxis</span><span class="p">]),</span> <span class="c1"># the straight line model</span>
            <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">sigma</span>  <span class="c1"># the data standard deviation</span>
        <span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"datatfp"</span><span class="p">,</span>  <span class="c1"># the name of the variable holding the data</span>
        <span class="n">reinterpreted_batch_ndims</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="p">))</span>
<span class="p">])</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'TensorFlow version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'TensorFlow Probability version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tfp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>TensorFlow version: 2.6.0-dev20210519
TensorFlow Probability version: 0.14.0-dev20210519
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next, the probablistic model must be wrapped in a function that takes in values of the parameters being sampled and returns the probability.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">target_log_prob_fn</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mvalue</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cvalue</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log_prob</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mvalue</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cvalue</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">datatfp</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can now set up the sampler and here we'll use the No U-turn Sampler (NUTS). For the set up of the <a href="https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/api_docs/python/tfp/mcmc/NoUTurnSampler"><code>NoUTurnSampler</code></a> we have to specify a step size (i.e., the size of the proposals). Some experimentation for our particular case shows a step size of 0.05 is reasonable, but it won't work for every case and most be tuned by hand. It also means that if different parameters have quite different dynamic ranges this method will not work well (it may produce jumps that are always for too big or small for certain sets of parameters).</p>
<p>Wrapping the sampling within a function (<code>do_sampling()</code>) with the <code>@tf.function</code> decorator compiles the model and means it runs far faster than without the wrapper.</p>
<p>We'll draw initial values of the <code>m</code> and <code>c</code> parameters from distributions that match their priors.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">Nsamples</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4000</span> <span class="c1"># final number of samples</span>
<span class="n">Nburn</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4000</span>    <span class="c1"># number of tuning samples</span>

<span class="c1"># set up Hamiltonian MC (within TensorFlow function to speed up computation)</span>
<span class="nd">@tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">autograph</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">do_sampling</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="c1"># set initial state (random draw from prior)</span>
    <span class="n">qc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">uniform</span><span class="p">([],</span> <span class="n">minval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">maxval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cmax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"init_c"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">qm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">normal</span><span class="p">([],</span> <span class="n">stddev</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">msigma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mean</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">mmu</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"init_m"</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">hmc_kernel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tfp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mcmc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">HamiltonianMonteCarlo</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">target_log_prob_fn</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_log_prob_fn</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">step_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">num_leapfrog_steps</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">tfp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mcmc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sample_chain</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">num_results</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nsamples</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">current_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">qm</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">qc</span><span class="p">],</span>
        <span class="n">kernel</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">hmc_kernel</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">num_burnin_steps</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nburn</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">states</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">kernel_results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">do_sampling</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timetfp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># extract the samples</span>
<span class="n">ms</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">states</span>

<span class="c1"># convert output states to numpy arrays</span>
<span class="n">samples_tfp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">vstack</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">ms</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">numpy</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">cs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">numpy</span><span class="p">()))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span>

<span class="n">num_accepted</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kernel_results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">is_accepted</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Acceptance rate: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num_accepted</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">Nsamples</span><span class="p">))</span>  <span class="c1"># print out acceptance rate</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>/opt/conda/envs/python37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow_probability/python/__init__.py:75: UserWarning: TensorFloat-32 matmul/conv are enabled for NVIDIA Ampere+ GPUs. The resulting loss of precision may hinder MCMC convergence. To turn off, run `tf.config.experimental.enable_tensor_float_32_execution(False)`. For more detail, see https://github.com/tensorflow/community/pull/287.
  'TensorFloat-32 matmul/conv are enabled for NVIDIA Ampere+ GPUs. The '
/opt/conda/envs/python37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow_probability/python/mcmc/sample.py:342: UserWarning: Tracing all kernel results by default is deprecated. Set the `trace_fn` argument to None (the future default value) or an explicit callback that traces the values you are interested in.
  warnings.warn('Tracing all kernel results by default is deprecated. Set '
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Acceptance rate: 0.927
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'TFP' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timetfp</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'TFP' is 4.815892219543457 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mtfp_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mtfp_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ctfp_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ctfp_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cctfp'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>

<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># calculate the autocorrelation length</span>
<span class="n">acts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">param</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"m"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"c"</span><span class="p">]):</span>
    <span class="n">acts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">emcee</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">autocorr</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">integrated_time</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]))</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Autocorrelation length for '</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">param</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Maximum autocorrelation length is </span><span class="si">{0:.1f}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'estfp'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_tfp</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esstfp'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'estfp'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timetfp</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esstfp'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Autocorrelation length for 'm' is [14.8794824]
Autocorrelation length for 'c' is [17.3901431]
Maximum autocorrelation length is 17.4
Effective samples per second: 47
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Zeus">Zeus<a class="anchor-link" href="#Zeus">¶</a></h3><p><a href="https://zeus-mcmc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/">Zeus</a> (<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2002.06212">Karamanis & Beutler, 2020</a>, <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2105.03468">Karamanis, Beutler & Peacock, 2021</a>) is a pure Python MCMC code that uses ensemble slice sampling. It is very similar in usage to <a href="#emcee">emcee</a>.</p>
<p>Zeus is available via PyPI and can be installed using <code>pip</code> with:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install zeus-mcmc
</pre></div>
<p>or with <a href="https://conda.io/docs/index.html">Conda</a> <a href="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/zeus-mcmc">with</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>conda install -c conda-forge zeus-mcmc
</pre></div>
<p>The Zeus source code is available on <a href="https://github.com/minaskar/zeus">Github</a>.</p>
<p>The Zeus documentation gives a nice <a href="https://zeus-mcmc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/notebooks/datafit.html">example of fitting a straight line</a>. The interface is so similar to <a href="#emcee">emcee</a> that we can reuse the <code>logprior</code>, <code>loglikelihood</code> and <code>logposterior</code> functions that we used in the case (I won't bother redefining them, so you'll have to scroll back up!). So, that just leaves the sampling. We will just leave any tunable parameters at their default values, but you can choose between a few different proposal distributions.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">zeus</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Zeus version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">zeus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">ndim</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>          <span class="c1"># Number of parameters/dimensions (e.g. m and c)</span>
<span class="n">Nens</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">100</span>        <span class="c1"># for consistency with the emcee example we'll use 100 </span>
<span class="n">Nburn</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">500</span>       <span class="c1"># burn-in samples</span>
<span class="n">Nsamples</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">500</span>    <span class="c1"># Nsamples</span>

<span class="c1"># set the initial samples (we'll draw from the prior)</span>
<span class="n">mini</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">normal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mmu</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">msigma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Nens</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># initial m points</span>
<span class="n">cini</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">uniform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Nens</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># initial c points</span>
<span class="n">inisamples</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">mini</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cini</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span> <span class="c1"># initial samples</span>

<span class="c1"># Initialise the sampler</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">zeus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">EnsembleSampler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Nens</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ndim</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logposterior</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">args</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1"># Run the sampler</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run_mcmc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inisamples</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Nburn</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">Nsamples</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timezeus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">t0</span>

<span class="c1"># print summary diagnostics</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">summary</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>Initialising ensemble of 100 walkers...
Sampling progress :   1%|          | 8/1000 [00:00<00:13, 72.51it/s]</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Zeus version: 2.3.0
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>Sampling progress : 100%|██████████| 1000/1000 [00:12<00:00, 79.13it/s]
Summary
-------
Number of Generations: 1000
Number of Parameters: 2
Number of Walkers: 100
Number of Tuning Generations: 14
Scale Factor: 0.641642
Mean Integrated Autocorrelation Time: 3.09
Effective Sample Size: 32373.08
Number of Log Probability Evaluations: 586000
Effective Samples per Log Probability Evaluation: 0.055244
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'Zeus' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timezeus</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'Zeus' is 12.64051866531372 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <a href="https://zeus-mcmc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/sampler.html#zeus.EnsembleSampler"><code>EnsembleSampler</code></a> object has a method to extract the posterior samples and we can discard the burn-in and thin the samples if required.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_chain</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">flat</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">discard</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nburn</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mzeus_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mzeus_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'czeus_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'czeus_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cczeus'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>

<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># calculate the autocorrelation length</span>
<span class="n">acts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">param</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"m"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"c"</span><span class="p">]):</span>
    <span class="n">acts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">emcee</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">autocorr</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">integrated_time</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]))</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Autocorrelation length for '</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">param</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Maximum autocorrelation length is </span><span class="si">{0:.1f}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'eszeus'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_zeus</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">acts</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esszeus'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'eszeus'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timezeus</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esszeus'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Autocorrelation length for 'm' is [3.08637982]
Autocorrelation length for 'c' is [3.09159199]
Maximum autocorrelation length is 3.1
Effective samples per second: 1279
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="MCMC-wrapper-samplers">MCMC wrapper samplers<a class="anchor-link" href="#MCMC-wrapper-samplers">¶</a></h3><p>There are other MCMC samplers that are not pure Python packages, but have a Python-based wrapper to a different library. With these you can't write pure Python model and probability functions, but instead have to create a code string that is then compiled and run using the underlying library functions. We will look at <a href="http://pystan.readthedocs.io">PyStan</a> and <a href="https://pyjags.readthedocs.io">PyJAGS</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="PyStan">PyStan<a class="anchor-link" href="#PyStan">¶</a></h3><p><a href="http://pystan.readthedocs.io">PyStan</a> is a Python interface to the popular <a href="http://mc-stan.org/">Stan</a> library. As with <a href="#PyMC3">PyMC3</a>, it uses the modern NUTS and Hamiltonain MC sampling methods. It can be <a href="http://pystan.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html#installation">installed</a> using <code>pip</code> with:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install pystan
</pre></div>
<p>or via Conda <a href="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pystan">with</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>conda install -c conda-forge pystan
</pre></div>
<p>and the source code is available on GitHub <a href="https://github.com/stan-dev/pystan">here</a>.</p>
<p>To define the model and distributions you need to write a code string like this:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># model and distributions for straight line fitting</span>
<span class="n">line_code</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"""</span>
<span class="s2">data {{</span>
<span class="s2">    int<lower=0> N;      // number of data points</span>
<span class="s2">    real y[N];           // observed data points</span>
<span class="s2">    real x[N];           // abscissa points</span>
<span class="s2">    real<lower=0> sigma; // standard deviation</span>
<span class="s2">}}</span>
<span class="s2">parameters {{</span>
<span class="s2">    // parameters for the fit</span>
<span class="s2">    real m;</span>
<span class="s2">    real c;</span>
<span class="s2">}}</span>
<span class="s2">transformed parameters {{</span>
<span class="s2">    real theta[N];</span>
<span class="s2">    for (j in 1:N)</span>
<span class="s2">    theta[j] = m * x[j] + c; // straight line model</span>
<span class="s2">}}</span>
<span class="s2">model {{</span>
<span class="s2">    m ~ normal(</span><span class="si">{mmu}</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">{msigma}</span><span class="s2">);     // prior on m (gradient)</span>
<span class="s2">    c ~ uniform(</span><span class="si">{clower}</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">{cupper}</span><span class="s2">); // prior on c (y-intercept)</span>
<span class="s2">    y ~ normal(theta, sigma);        // likelihood of the data given the model</span>
<span class="s2">}}</span>
<span class="s2">"""</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>You can then define the inputs to the <code>data</code> section in a dictionary:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># set the data and the abscissa</span>
<span class="n">linear_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="s1">'N'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span>          <span class="c1"># number of data points</span>
    <span class="s1">'y'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span>       <span class="c1"># observed data (converted from numpy array to a list)</span>
    <span class="s1">'x'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span>          <span class="c1"># abscissa points (converted from numpy array to a list)</span>
    <span class="s1">'sigma'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">,</span>  <span class="c1"># standard deviation</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now you can compile the model and run the sampler, with 1000 iterations and 4 chains, with:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%capture</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pystan</span>  <span class="c1"># import PyStan</span>

<span class="n">Nsamples</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1000</span>  <span class="c1"># set the number of iterations of the sampler</span>
<span class="n">chains</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4</span>       <span class="c1"># set the number of chains to run with</span>

<span class="c1"># dictionary for inputs into line_code</span>
<span class="n">linedict</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
<span class="n">linedict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mmu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.0</span>     <span class="c1"># mean of Gaussian prior distribution for m</span>
<span class="n">linedict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'msigma'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>   <span class="c1"># standard deviation of Gaussian prior distribution for m</span>
<span class="n">linedict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'clower'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">10</span>  <span class="c1"># lower bound on uniform prior distribution for c</span>
<span class="n">linedict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cupper'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>   <span class="c1"># upper bound on uniform prior distribution for c</span>

<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">sm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pystan</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">StanModel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">model_code</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">line_code</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="n">linedict</span><span class="p">));</span> <span class="c1"># compile model</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timepystancomp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">fit</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sampling</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">linear_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">iter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Nsamples</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">chains</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">chains</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="c1"># perform sampling</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timepystan</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>COMPILING THE C++ CODE FOR MODEL anon_model_15aa743a6e306b61e6880db7be28ca62 NOW.
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [34]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'PyStan version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pystan</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to comile 'PyStan' model is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timepystancomp</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'PyStan' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timepystan</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>PyStan version: 2.19.1.1
Time taken to comile 'PyStan' model is 41.173564434051514 seconds
Time taken to run 'PyStan' is 0.36288952827453613 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>PyStan does have a plotting function (you could run <code>fit.plot()</code>), but we'll extract the chains and use <code>corner.py</code>:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [35]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">la</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">fit</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">extract</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">permuted</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>  <span class="c1"># return a dictionary of arrays</span>
