</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [54]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'CPNest' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timecpnest</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'CPNest' is 17.42618751525879 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can again extract the value of $\ln{Z}$ and its uncertainty. One simple bit of model comparison that we may want to do is to compare the evidence for the model of the data containg a straight line (with the given priors on the parameter), with the evidence for a model that the data just contains independent Gaussian noise with the given standard deviation. We can calculate the latter evidence easily by just setting the model to zero in the log-likelihood function, e.g.:</p>
$$
\ln{Z}_{\rm noise} = -\frac{M}{2}\ln{(2\pi)} - \ln\left(\prod_{i=1}^M \sigma_i\right) - \sum_{i=1}^M\frac{d_i^2}{2\sigma_i^2}.
$$<p>The natural logarithm of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayes_factor">Bayes factor</a> comparing the two models is then:</p>
$$
\ln{\mathcal{B}} = \ln{Z} - \ln{Z}_{\rm noise}.
$$<p>We will also extract this value.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [55]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">logZcpnest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">NS</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logZ</span>                     <span class="c1"># value of log Z</span>
<span class="n">infogaincpnest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">NS</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">state</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">info</span>           <span class="c1"># value of the information gain</span>
<span class="n">logZerrcpnest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">infogaincpnest</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">nlive</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># estimate of the statistcal uncertainty on logZ</span>

<span class="c1"># get the null log likelihood (evidence that the data is Gaussian noise with zero mean, and given standard devaition)</span>
<span class="n">logZnull</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log_likelihood</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'m'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">0.</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">0.</span><span class="p">})</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"log(Z) = </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> ± </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logZcpnest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logZerrcpnest</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># output the log Bayes factor</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'log Bayes factor is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logZcpnest</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">logZnull</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>log(Z) = -116.80257733898489 ± 0.08359347188542411
log Bayes factor is 2633.843652183457
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>CPNest will itself resample from the nested samples to give posterior samples held in a dictionary, which we can plot.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [56]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">mchain_cpnest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">posterior_samples</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'m'</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># extract chain of m values</span>
<span class="n">cchain_cpnest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">posterior_samples</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># extract chain if c values</span>
<span class="n">samples_cpnest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">vstack</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">mchain_cpnest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cchain_cpnest</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span>

<span class="c1"># print out the number of posterior samples</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of posterior samples is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mcpnest_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mcpnest_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccpnest_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccpnest_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cccpnest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpnest_npos'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">)</span>              <span class="c1"># number of posterior samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpnest_time'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">timecpnest</span>                       <span class="c1"># run time</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpnest_logZ'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logZcpnest</span>                       <span class="c1"># log marginalised likelihood</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpnest_logZerr'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logZerrcpnest</span>                 <span class="c1"># uncertainty on log(Z)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot using corner.py</span>
<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Number of posterior samples is 2754
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [57]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">cpnest.nest2pos</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">compute_weights</span>
<span class="n">_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compute_weights</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_nested_samples</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="s2">"logL"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">work</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">nlive</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">weights</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'escpnest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">weights</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esscpnest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'escpnest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timecpnest</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esscpnest'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Effective samples per second: 229
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="dynesty">dynesty<a class="anchor-link" href="#dynesty">¶</a></h3><p><a href="https://dynesty.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html">dynesty</a> (<a href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2020MNRAS.493.3132S/abstract">Speagle, 2019</a>) is a pure Python-based implementation of the dynamic nested sampling algorithm (<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.03459">Higson <em>et al</em>, 2017</a>). It is very similar in usage to <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a>. Dynamic nested sampling is a way of dynamically adapting the number of live points used to provide more accurate evidence estimates and/or larger numbers of independent posterior samples. The code can run using dynamic adjustment of live points or just in a "static" mode with a fixed number of live points. There a many options for how the new live points are drawn, both in terms of the <a href="https://dynesty.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart.html#bounding-options">bounds</a> from which they are drawn and the <a href="https://dynesty.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart.html#sampling-options">sampling</a> from within those bounds. The bound options include the using bounding ellipsoids in the style of <a href="#PyMultiNest">MultiNest</a>, or the RadFriends algorithm of <a href="#UltraNest">UltraNest</a>, among others. The sampling options include uniform draws from the bounds, random walks, or slice sampling in the style of <a href="#PyPolyChord">PolyChord</a>. If not explicitly specified, dynesty will <a href="https://dynesty.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart.html#sampling-options">select</a> a sampling algorithm based on the number of dimensions of the problem being tackled.</p>
<p>dynesty is available on <a href="https://pypi.org/">PyPI</a> and can be installed with <code>pip</code> using:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install dynesty
</pre></div>
<p>or using Conda <a href="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/dynesty">with</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>conda install -c conda-forge dynesty
</pre></div>
<blockquote><p><strong>Note</strong>: Other dynamic nested sampling codes exist such as <a href="http://dypolychord.readthedocs.io/en/latest/">dyPolyChord</a> and <a href="https://github.com/ejhigson/perfectns"><code>perfectns</code></a>.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>The likelihood function and prior transform can be set up in a way that is identical to <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> (we'll define both again below for completeness), with the differences being in how the sampler is called. Here we will show the sampling being used for both "<em>static</em>" and "<em>dynamic</em>" nested sampling.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [58]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># import the inverse error function from scipy</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy.special</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">ndtri</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">prior_transform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    A function defining the tranform between the parameterisation in the unit hypercube</span>
<span class="sd">    to the true parameters.</span>

<span class="sd">    Args:</span>
<span class="sd">        theta (tuple): a tuple containing the parameters.</span>
<span class="sd">        </span>
<span class="sd">    Returns:</span>
<span class="sd">        tuple: a new tuple or array with the transformed parameters.</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="n">mprime</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cprime</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">theta</span> <span class="c1"># unpack the parameters (in their unit hypercube form)</span>

    <span class="n">cmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">10.</span>  <span class="c1"># lower bound on uniform prior on c</span>
    <span class="n">cmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span>   <span class="c1"># upper bound on uniform prior on c</span>

    <span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.</span>     <span class="c1"># mean of Gaussian prior on m</span>
    <span class="n">msigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span> <span class="c1"># standard deviation of Gaussian prior on m</span>

    <span class="n">m</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">msigma</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">ndtri</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mprime</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># convert back to m</span>
    <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cprime</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cmax</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">cmin</span>  <span class="c1"># convert back to c</span>

    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="c1"># set the natural logarithm of 2pi, so that it doesn't have to be recalculated</span>
<span class="n">LN2PI</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">2.</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pi</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">LNSIGMA</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># natural log of the data noise standard deviation</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">loglikelihood_dynesty</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    The log-likelihood function.</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">theta</span> <span class="c1"># unpack the parameters</span>

    <span class="c1"># normalisation</span>
    <span class="n">norm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.5</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">M</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">LN2PI</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">M</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">LNSIGMA</span>

    <span class="c1"># chi-squared (data, sigma and x are global variables defined early on in this notebook)</span>
    <span class="n">chisq</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(((</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">straight_line</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">norm</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">chisq</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>First we'll run with the "static" sampler. For consistency with <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> and <a href="#CPNest">CPNest</a> we'll use 1024 live points and a stopping criterion of 0.1. As with our <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> example we will use the <a href="#PyMultiNest">MultiNest</a>-style bounding ellipsoids, but with <a href="https://dynesty.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#dynesty.sampling.sample_unif">uniform</a> sampling based on the low-dimensionality of the problem.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [59]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># import dynesty</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">dynesty</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'dynesty version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dynesty</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">nlive</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1024</span>      <span class="c1"># number of live points</span>
<span class="n">bound</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'multi'</span>   <span class="c1"># use MutliNest algorithm for bounds</span>
<span class="n">ndims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>         <span class="c1"># two parameters</span>
<span class="n">sample</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'unif'</span>   <span class="c1"># uniform sampling</span>
<span class="n">tol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.1</span>         <span class="c1"># the stopping criterion</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">dynesty</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">NestedSampler</span>

<span class="n">sampler</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">NestedSampler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loglikelihood_dynesty</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">prior_transform</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ndims</span><span class="p">,</span>
                        <span class="n">bound</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">bound</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sample</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">sample</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nlive</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">nlive</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run_nested</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dlogz</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">tol</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">print_progress</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># don't output progress bar</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timedynesty</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'dynesty' (in static mode) is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timedynesty</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>dynesty version: 1.1
Time taken to run 'dynesty' (in static mode) is 3.2678871154785156 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can extract the value of the marginal likelihood, $\ln{⁡Z}$, and its uncertainties with the following:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [60]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">res</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">results</span> <span class="c1"># get results dictionary from sampler</span>

<span class="n">logZdynesty</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logz</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>        <span class="c1"># value of logZ</span>
<span class="n">logZerrdynesty</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logzerr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># estimate of the statistcal uncertainty on logZ</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"log(Z) = </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> ± </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logZdynesty</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logZerrdynesty</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>log(Z) = -116.66207844899319 ± 0.11680906514881793
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Or, get a summary of this information using:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [61]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">summary</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Summary
=======
nlive: 1024
niter: 10600
ncall: 50103
eff(%): 23.200
logz: -116.662 +/-  0.117
None
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As with <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> we need to draw posterior samples from the nested samples based on their prior weights.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [62]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># get function that resamples from the nested samples to give sampler with equal weight</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">dynesty.utils</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">resample_equal</span>

<span class="c1"># draw posterior samples</span>
<span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'logwt'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'logz'</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">samples_dynesty</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">resample_equal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">res</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">samples</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weights</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mdynesty_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mdynesty_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cdynesty_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cdynesty_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccdynesty'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'dynesty_npos'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">)</span>              <span class="c1"># number of posterior samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'dynesty_time'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">timedynesty</span>                       <span class="c1"># run time</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'dynesty_logZ'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logZdynesty</span>                       <span class="c1"># log marginalised likelihood</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'dynesty_logZerr'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logZerrdynesty</span>                 <span class="c1"># uncertainty on log(Z)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of posterior samples is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="c1"># plot using corner.py</span>
<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Number of posterior samples is 11624
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [63]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esdynesty'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">res</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"logwt"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">logZdynesty</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'essdynesty'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esdynesty'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timedynesty</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'essdynesty'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Effective samples per second: 1246
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can now do the same thing, but with the "dynamic" sampler. For this we can specify an initial number of live points (we will stick with 1024), but the actual number used will evolve. The <a href="https://dynesty.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dynamic.html#stopping-function">stopping criterion</a> for the dynamic method is more complex than for the static case, and we will just leave it at the default values.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [64]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># import the dynamic nested sampler</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">dynesty</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">DynamicNestedSampler</span>

<span class="c1"># set up the sampler</span>
<span class="n">dsampler</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">DynamicNestedSampler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loglikelihood_dynesty</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">prior_transform</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ndims</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                <span class="n">bound</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">bound</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sample</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">sample</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># run the sampler (not that we have not included the dlogz tolerance)</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">dsampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run_nested</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nlive_init</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">nlive</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">print_progress</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timedynestydynamic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'dynesty' (in dynamic mode) is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timedynestydynamic</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'dynesty' (in dynamic mode) is 115.42199993133545 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's just compare the marginal likelihoods and numbers of posterior samples between the static and dynamic methods.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [65]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dres</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dsampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">results</span> <span class="c1"># get results dictionary from sampler</span>

<span class="n">logZdynestydynamic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logz</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>        <span class="c1"># value of logZ</span>
<span class="n">logZerrdynestydynamic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logzerr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># estimate of the statistcal uncertainty on logZ</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Static: log(Z) = </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> ± </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logZdynesty</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logZerrdynesty</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Dynamic: log(Z) = </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> ± </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logZdynestydynamic</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logZerrdynestydynamic</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># draw posterior samples</span>
<span class="n">dweights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dres</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'logwt'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">dres</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'logz'</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">samples_dynestydynamic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">resample_equal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">samples</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dweights</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">essdynestydynamic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dres</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"logwt"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">logZdynestydynamic</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Static: num. posterior samples: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Dynamic: num. posterior samples: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_dynestydynamic</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Static: effective sample size: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esdynesty'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Dynamic: effective sample size: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">essdynestydynamic</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Static: log(Z) = -116.66207844899319 ± 0.11680906514881793
Dynamic: log(Z) = -116.70461530428305 ± 0.11701110275760397
Static: num. posterior samples: 11624
Dynamic: num. posterior samples: 25519
Static: effective sample size: 4074
Dynamic: effective sample size: 16617
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="UltraNest">UltraNest<a class="anchor-link" href="#UltraNest">¶</a></h3><p><a href="https://johannesbuchner.github.io/UltraNest/">UltraNest</a> is Python-based implementation of the nested sampling, that contains several <a href="https://johannesbuchner.github.io/UltraNest/method.html">sampling algorithms</a> designed for correctness of sampling. One particular method it provides is called RadFriends (<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1407.5459">Buchner, 2014</a>) that is designed to be robust against effects caused by inaccuracies of drawing new samples from the constrained prior.</p>
<p>UltraNest is available from its <a href="https://github.com/JohannesBuchner/UltraNest.git">github repository</a>, but can be installed form PyPi using</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install ultranest
</pre></div>
<p>or using Conda <a href="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/ultranest">with</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>conda install -c conda-forge ultranest
</pre></div>
<p>Similarly to <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> and <a href="#dynesty">dynesty</a>, UltraNest samples from a unit hypercube, and therefore you have to defined a <a href="#Setting-the-prior-transform">prior transformation function</a>, so we can set up these functions in a very similar way to what we have seen <a href="#Nestle">above</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [66]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># define the prior transform</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy.special</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">ndtri</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">prior_transform_ultranest</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    A function defining the tranform between the parameterisation in the unit hypercube</span>
<span class="sd">    to the true parameters.</span>

<span class="sd">    Args:</span>
<span class="sd">        theta (list): a list/array containing the parameters.</span>
<span class="sd">        </span>
<span class="sd">    Returns:</span>
<span class="sd">        list: a new list/array with the transformed parameters.</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="c1"># unpack the parameters (in their unit hypercube form)</span>
    <span class="n">mprime</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">cprime</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

    <span class="n">cmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">10.</span>  <span class="c1"># lower bound on uniform prior on c</span>
    <span class="n">cmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span>   <span class="c1"># upper bound on uniform prior on c</span>

    <span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.</span>     <span class="c1"># mean of Gaussian prior on m</span>
    <span class="n">msigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span> <span class="c1"># standard deviation of Gaussian prior on m</span>

    <span class="n">m</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">msigma</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">ndtri</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mprime</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># convert back to m</span>
    <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cprime</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cmax</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">cmin</span>  <span class="c1"># convert back to c</span>

    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can again define the likelihood in a very similay way to <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [67]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">LN2PI</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">2.</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pi</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">LNSIGMA</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># define the Gaussian likelihood function</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">loglikelihood_ultranest</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    The log-likelihood function.</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="c1"># unpack the parameters</span>
    <span class="n">m</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">theta</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

    <span class="c1"># normalisation</span>
    <span class="n">norm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">LN2PI</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">M</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">LNSIGMA</span>

    <span class="c1"># chi-squared (data, sigma and x are global variables defined early on in this notebook)</span>
    <span class="n">chisq</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(((</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">straight_line</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">norm</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">chisq</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To run UltraNest we'll use the <a href="https://johannesbuchner.github.io/UltraNest/ultranest.html#ultranest.integrator.ReactiveNestedSampler"><code>ReactiveNestedSampler</code></a> method. Unlike other nested sampling methods, this does not require you to specify the number of live points to use. It will automatically adjust the number as required, starting with a default minimum of 400.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [68]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">ultranest</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'UltraNest version: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ultranest</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">__version__</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># set the ReactiveNestedSampler method</span>
<span class="n">sampler</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ultranest</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ReactiveNestedSampler</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"m"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"c"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">loglikelihood_ultranest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">prior_transform_ultranest</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">ndims</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>         <span class="c1"># two parameters</span>
<span class="n">tol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.1</span>         <span class="c1"># the stopping criterion</span>

<span class="c1"># run the nested sampling algorithm</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">result</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampler</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dlogz</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">tol</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timeultranest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">

<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'UltraNest' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timeultranest</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can extract the value of the marginal likelihood, $\ln{Z}$, and its uncertainties with the following:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [70]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">logZultranest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'logz'</span><span class="p">]</span>        <span class="c1"># value of logZ</span>
<span class="n">logZerrultranest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'logzerr'</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># estimate of the statistcal uncertainty on logZ</span>

<span class="c1"># output marginal likelihood</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Marginalised evidence is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> ± </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logZultranest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">logZerrultranest</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Marginalised evidence is -116.83266582912734 ± 0.17742441776372703
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can now resample from the nested samples to get the posterior samples.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [71]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">points</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"weighted_samples"</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s2">"points"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"weighted_samples"</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s2">"weights"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">scaledweights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">weights</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">mask</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rand</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">scaledweights</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="n">scaledweights</span>

<span class="n">samples_ultranest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">points</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">mask</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">:]</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'multranest_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'multranest_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cultranest_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cultranest_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccultranest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ultranest_npos'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">)</span>              <span class="c1"># number of posterior samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ultranest_time'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">timeultranest</span>                       <span class="c1"># run time</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ultranest_logZ'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logZultranest</span>                       <span class="c1"># log marginalised likelihood</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ultranest_logZerr'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">logZerrultranest</span>                 <span class="c1"># uncertainty on log(Z)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot using corner.py</span>
<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of posterior samples is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Number of posterior samples is 1085
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"/>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [72]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esultranest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ess</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">weights</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'essultranest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'esultranest'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">timeultranest</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Effective samples per second: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'essultranest'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Effective samples per second: 223
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We will now look at some nested sampling algorithms that are not pure Python, but do have Python wrappers.</p>
<h3 id="PyMultiNest">PyMultiNest<a class="anchor-link" href="#PyMultiNest">¶</a></h3><p><a href="http://johannesbuchner.github.io/PyMultiNest/">PyMultiNest</a> (<a href="https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/04/aa22971-13/aa22971-13.html">Buchner <em>et al</em>, 2014</a>) is a wrapper to the popular <a href="https://github.com/farhanferoz/MultiNest">MultiNest</a> code (<a href="http://xxx.lanl.gov/abs/0704.3704">Feroz & Hobson, 2008</a> & <a href="http://xxx.lanl.gov/abs/0704.3704">Feroz <em>et al</em>, 2009</a>), which has been particularly taken up by the astrophysics and cosmology community. The basics underlying MultiNest were described in relation to <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a>, although MultiNest can use more sophisticated sampling methods, such as importance sampling (<a href="http://xxx.lanl.gov/abs/1306.2144v2">Feroz <em>et al</em>, 2014</a>).</p>
<p>To use PyMultiNest, the MultiNest library itself must be installed (MultiNest can be downloaded from GitHub <a href="https://github.com/farhanferoz/MultiNest">here</a>). Installation of PyMultiNest and its requirements are described <a href="http://johannesbuchner.github.io/PyMultiNest/install.html">here</a>; once MultiNest is installed you can then install PyMultiNest using <code>pip</code> with:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>pip install pymultinest
</pre></div>
<p>A simpler solution, that comes bundled with MultiNest, is to install using <a href="https://conda.io/en/latest/index.html">Conda</a> <a href="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/pymultinest">with</a>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>conda install -c conda-forge pymultinest
</pre></div>
<blockquote><p><strong>Note</strong>: If using MultiNest, and software wrapping it, for your work please note the software license restrictions <a href="https://github.com/farhanferoz/MultiNest/blob/master/MultiNest_v3.11/LICENCE">here</a>.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Some examples of running PyMultiNest can be found <a href="http://johannesbuchner.github.io/pymultinest-tutorial/">here</a>, although an interface through a <a href="https://github.com/JohannesBuchner/PyMultiNest/blob/master/pymultinest_demo.py"><code>solver</code> function</a> and <a href="https://github.com/JohannesBuchner/PyMultiNest/blob/master/pymultinest_solver_demo.py"><code>Solver</code> class</a> are also available. We'll use the <code>Solver</code> class method, which can take in the same initialisation keyword arguments as the <a href="http://johannesbuchner.github.io/PyMultiNest/pymultinest_run.html"><code>run()</code> method</a>.</p>
<p>We use the <code>Solver</code> class to create a new class for our specific example. As with <a href="#CPNest">CPNest</a> we use this class to define our log likeihood function, and like <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> we define a prior transform to go from a unit hypercube to the true parameterisation. These functions can only take in arrays of the parameter values that we are exploring and cannot take in additional arguments. Therefore any additional values required must either be global variables, or a new <code>__init__</code> method for the class must be defined. We'll show the latter of these.</p>
<blockquote><p><strong>Note</strong>: PyMultiNest is also available in Python through the <a href="http://monte-python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/nested.html">Monte Python</a> package.</p>
</blockquote>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [73]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># import the Solver class</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pymultinest</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">pymultinest.solve</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Solver</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy.special</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">ndtri</span>

<span class="n">LN2PI</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">2.</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pi</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">StraightLineModelPyMultiNest</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Solver</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">    A simple straight line model, with a Gaussian likelihood.</span>

<span class="sd">    Args:</span>
<span class="sd">        data (:class:`numpy.ndarray`): an array containing the observed data</span>
<span class="sd">        abscissa (:class:`numpy.ndarray`): an array containing the points at which the data were taken</span>
<span class="sd">        modelfunc (function): a function defining the model</span>
<span class="sd">        sigma (float): the standard deviation of the noise in the data</span>
<span class="sd">        **kwargs: keyword arguments for the run method</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>

    <span class="c1"># define the prior parameters</span>
    <span class="n">cmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">10.</span>  <span class="c1"># lower range on c (the same as the uniform c prior lower bound)</span>
    <span class="n">cmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span>   <span class="c1"># upper range on c (the same as the uniform c prior upper bound)</span>

    <span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.</span>     <span class="c1"># mean of the Gaussian prior on m</span>
    <span class="n">msigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">10.</span> <span class="c1"># standard deviation of the Gaussian prior on m</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__init__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">abscissa</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">modelfunc</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">kwargs</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1"># set the data</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span>         <span class="c1"># oberserved data</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_abscissa</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">abscissa</span> <span class="c1"># points at which the observed data are taken</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_sigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sigma</span>       <span class="c1"># standard deviation(s) of the data</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_logsigma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># log sigma here to save computations in the likelihood</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_ndata</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># number of data points</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">modelfunc</span>   <span class="c1"># model function</span>

        <span class="n">Solver</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="fm">__init__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">kwargs</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">Prior</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cube</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">        The prior transform going from the unit hypercube to the true parameters. This function</span>
<span class="sd">        has to be called "Prior".</span>

<span class="sd">        Args:</span>
<span class="sd">            cube (:class:`numpy.ndarray`): an array of values drawn from the unit hypercube</span>

<span class="sd">        Returns:</span>
<span class="sd">            :class:`numpy.ndarray`: an array of the transformed parameters</span>
<span class="sd">        """</span>

        <span class="c1"># extract values</span>
        <span class="n">mprime</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cube</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">cprime</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cube</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

        <span class="n">m</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mmu</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">msigma</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">ndtri</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mprime</span><span class="p">)</span>      <span class="c1"># convert back to m</span>
        <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cprime</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cmax</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cmin</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cmin</span>  <span class="c1"># convert back to c</span>

        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">])</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">LogLikelihood</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cube</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="sd">"""</span>
<span class="sd">        The log likelihood function. This function has to be called "LogLikelihood".</span>

<span class="sd">        Args:</span>
<span class="sd">            cube (:class:`numpy.ndarray`): an array of parameter values.</span>

<span class="sd">        Returns:</span>
<span class="sd">            float: the log likelihood value.</span>
<span class="sd">        """</span>

        <span class="c1"># extract parameters</span>
        <span class="n">m</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cube</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cube</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>

        <span class="c1"># calculate the model</span>
        <span class="n">model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_model</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">)</span>

        <span class="c1"># normalisation</span>
        <span class="n">norm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_ndata</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">LN2PI</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_ndata</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_logsigma</span>

        <span class="c1"># chi-squared</span>
        <span class="n">chisq</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(((</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_data</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_sigma</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>

        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">norm</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">chisq</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we can run the sampler. As before we'll use 1024 live points, and like with <a href="#Nestle">Nestle</a> we'll use a stopping criterion of 0.1. By default the sampler will use importance sampling.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [74]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">nlive</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1024</span> <span class="c1"># number of live points</span>
<span class="n">ndim</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>     <span class="c1"># number of parameters</span>
<span class="n">tol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.1</span>    <span class="c1"># stopping criterion</span>

<span class="c1"># run the algorithm</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">solution</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">StraightLineModelPyMultiNest</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">straight_line</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sigma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_dims</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">ndim</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                        <span class="n">n_live_points</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">nlive</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">evidence_tolerance</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">tol</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timepymultinest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
